technology.name: Spearwall
technology.description: One of the most impressive, iconic sights of an Elven warhost is the wall of spears, perfectly arranged for maximum effect.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for High Elf Spearmen, Lothern Sea Guard and Silverin Guard

technology.name: Militia Training
technology.description: All citizens of Ulthuan must join a militia and attend regular training, by order of the Phoenix King.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units

technology.name: Precise Fletching
technology.description: The world's best archers require the very best arrows.

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Gate Guard, Ellyrian Reaver Archers, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers/striders, Sisters of Avelorn and Chariot units
Ammunition: +20% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Gate Guard, Ellyrian Reaver Archers, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers/striders, Sisters of Avelorn and Tiranoc Chariot units

technology.name: Martial Law
technology.description: In times of war, it is best to be prepared for the long haul.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units

technology.name: Drummers
technology.description: Among the Asur, unflinching, unending war has a distinctive rhythm all its own.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -5% for melee infantry units
Speed: +15% for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth, Sisters of Avelorn and Phoenix Guard units

technology.name: Mounted Hornblowers
technology.description: Forward! For Ulthuan! For the Phoenix King! Charrrrrge!

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -5% for cavalry units
Speed: +15% for Chariot and Skycutter units
Speed: +15% for Ellyrian Reavers, Silver Helms and Dragon Princes units

technology.name: Fireborn Nature
technology.description: The hotter it is, the wilder the beast, so intrinsic is fire to their nature.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Phoenix and Dragon units
Melee attack: +5 for Phoenix and Dragon units

technology.name: Dragon's Bond
technology.description: Both the song and the singer are crucial if Dragon and rider are to form a bond that lasts a lifetime.

effects.description: Army ability: "Amber Rain" for Teclis and Beast Archmages

ui_effects.description: ➕ Calls down 15 projectiles each dealing 0 1000 damage and 0 250 explosion damage (4m)

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: -5 with all factions except High Elves

Vigour loss reduction: -10%
	(own armies when in enemy territory)
Units gain +2% weapon and missile strength per rank achieved
Diplomatic relations: -5 with all factions except High Elves
Income from post-battle loot: +25% against Dark Elves

Upkeep: -10% for all units
	(own armies when in enemy territory)

technology.name: Naval Discipline
technology.description: Try and stay in the ship. That's the first lesson and it will keep you alive!

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Lothern Sea Guard units
Melee defence: +5 for Lothern Sea Guard units

technology.name: Appoint Sea Masters
technology.description: Those among the Sea Guard who show better-than-average aptitude may find themselves promoted in due course.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Lothern Sea Guard units

technology.name: Light Ithilmar Armour
technology.description: Ithilmar is an unusual substance in that it offers full protection but without the encumbrance of a full suit of plate armour.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Spearmen, Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow Walkers, Rangers, Silverin Guard and Sisters of Avelorn units

technology.name: Recall Colonists
technology.description: Some of the Asur's coastal colonies have fallen into disrepair and many colonists have maritime skills that could be useful to the Sea Guard at home.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Lothern Sea Guard units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Lothern Sea Guard units

technology.name: Highborn Champions
technology.description: Those of noble birth have the time to become well practiced in war's terrible arts.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Silver Helms, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers/striders and Chariot units

technology.name: Chariot Anthems
technology.description: The Elves of Tiranoc all know its battle song, a rousing anthem sung by their number since ancient times.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Chariot and Skycutter units
Charge bonus: +10 for Chariot, and Skycutter units

technology.name: Obligations of Nobility
technology.description: Nobility obliges me to recognise the virtue of an exceptional commoner.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Dragon Princes units

technology.name: Friends in High Places
technology.description: It's not what you know but who.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace, Phoenix Guard and Dragon Princes units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace, Phoenix Guard and Dragon Princes units
You need to choose Retribution or Unity. There is no turning back!
All linked technologies require Retribution currency

Charge bonus: +100% when fighting against Greenskin Tribes
	(all characters factionwide)
Construction time: -1 for Wall and Garrison buildings
Construction time: +1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Gifts of Isha generated: +1 per turn

technology.name: Military Advancements I
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' finely-tuned military machine to a higher level altogether.

technology.name: Light Cavalry Barding
technology.description: Barding of this kind gives the Reavers' mounts extra protection whilst they deliver their devastating charges.

technology.name: Horsemasters
technology.description: It is both the right and duty of Ulthuan's perfect cavalry to repeat the achievements of their glorious ancestors.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units

technology.name: Military Advancements II
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' finely-tuned military machine to a higher level altogether.

technology.name: Skirmishing Saddles
technology.description: Being able to control your steed with only your knees frees up the hands for blade, point or bow.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +15 for Ellyrian Reavers units
Range: +15% for Ellyrian Reaver Archers units

technology.name: Harbingers Called
technology.description: The deadliest part of Ulthuan's armies just got deadlier.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -10% for Ellyrian Reavers units

technology.name: Military Advancements III
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' finely-tuned military machine to a higher level altogether.

technology.name: Heavy Ithilmar Armour
technology.description: Ithilmar is an unusual substance in that it offers full protection but without the encumbrance of a full suit of plate armour.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Silver Helms and Dragon Princes units
Armour: +10 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units

technology.name: Starmetal Blades
technology.description: Only the very best blades are made from star-metal; only Dwarfen gromril comes close in hardness and strength.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5% for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth and Phoenix Guard units
Weapon strength: +10% for White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
Melee attack: +5 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units

technology.name: Military Advancements IV
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' finely-tuned military machine to a higher level altogether.

technology.name: Wardings of Vaul
technology.description: The finest suits of armour are forged in the Anvil of Vaul at Caledor, and contain the Smith-God's protection.

effects.description: Ward save: 5% for Dragon Princes units
Melee defence: +5 for Dragon Princes units

technology.name: Blessings of Asuryan
technology.description: Knowledge of the end informs the individual and guides their actions.

effects.description: Ward save: 5% for Phoenix Guard units
Melee defence: +5 for Phoenix Guard units

Ward save: 10% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Norsca and Beastmen
	(all characters factionwide)

Physical resistance: +15% when fighting against Dark Elves
	(all characters factionwide)
Diplomatic relations: -5 with all factions except High Elves
Missile resistance: 5% when fighting against Dark Elves
Physical resistance: +5% when fighting against Dark Elves

technology.name: Archery Prowess
technology.description: It takes centuries to become this good, but the Asur have time on their side.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +15% for Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units

technology.name: Cartridge Ammunition
technology.description: Whereby bolts and arrows can be stored for swift access when the ebb and flow of battle demands.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +20% for Eagle Claw Bolt Thrower units
Reload time reduction: +20% for Tiranoc Chariot and Skycutter units

technology.name: Massed Charge
technology.description: The finest sons of the Ulthuan nobility, acting as one, without hesitation, to bring death to their homeland's enemies.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers/striders and Silver Helms units
Charge bonus: +10 for Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers/striders and Silver Helms units

technology.name: Vows of Fealty
technology.description: Minor nobles often choose a patron from more prestigious quarters, swearing allegiance to their house.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Silver Helms, Chariot, and Skycutter units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Silver Helms, Chariot, and Skycutter units

technology.name: Arcane Studies
technology.description: When a course takes several centuries to complete, you can be sure that its students know their subject inside and out.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Loremasters of Hoeth and Mages

technology.name: Magical Infusion
technology.description: Certain creatures are highly attuned to the Winds of Magic, making them that little bit more sensitive to the benefits of enchantment.

technology.name: Elite Champions
technology.description: Oft times, pride comes afore a fall. Not in this case.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmaster, Phoenix Guard, Sisters of Avelorn and Dragon Princes units
Melee attack: +2 for all units (Rank 7 and above)
Missile damage: +4% for all units (Rank 7 and above)

technology.name: Ancient Lair Warding
technology.description: The Naggarothi expend much energy and resources in trying to steal Dragon Eggs, prompting their Asur cousins to ward their allies' ancient lairs against infiltration.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Great Eagle, Phoenix, War Lions and Dragon units
Melee defence: +2 for all units (Rank 7 and above)
Army ability: "Breach of Shades" for Teclis and Shadow Archmages

Leadership aura size: +100% when fighting against Empire
	(all characters factionwide)

Attribute: Causes Fear when fighting against Empire
	(all characters factionwide)

Bonus vs Infantry: +10 when fighting against Skaven
	(all characters factionwide)
Attribute: Causes Terror when fighting against Greenskins
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Dark Elves
Missile strength: +15% when fighting against Dark Elves
Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

technology.name: Trumpeters
technology.description: The cadence of military music enables the maintenance of order and discipline in the fray's desperate, blood-soaked moments.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Spearmen, Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Rangers, Silverin Guard, Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walker units

technology.name: Swiftsense
technology.description: An eagle's senses match their speed in flight, making them excellent spotters and swift killers.

effects.description: Speed: +20% for Great Eagle and War Lion units
Charge bonus: +10 for Great Eagle and War Lion units

technology.name: Shredding Talons
technology.description: Yes, they're sharp enough. Be sure not to put your hand anywhere near the end.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Great Eagle and War Lion units
Melee attack: +5 for Great Eagle and War Lion units

technology.name: Annulii Roosts
technology.description: As many eagles and phoenixes hail from these huge magical mountains, it makes sense to foster new recruits here as early as possible.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Great Eagle, War Lions and Phoenix units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Great Eagle and Phoenix units

technology.name: Broadhead Arrows
technology.description: Wide, flat-headed arrows are both easy to store and more effective at slicing through massed ranks of the foe than standard designs.

effects.description: Ammunition: +20% for Eagle Claw Bolt Thrower, Tiranoc Chariot and Skycutter units
Range: +20% for Eagle Claw Bolt Thrower, Tiranoc Chariot and Skycutter units

technology.name: From the Shadowlands
technology.description: Those hailing from Nagarythe are adept fletchers, using raven feathers to create their own lethal designs.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walkers/striders units
Melee attack: +5 for Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walkers/striders units
Reload time reduction: +15% for Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walkers/striders units
Missile resistance: 10% for Shadow Warriors and Shadow-walkers/striders units

technology.name: Teachings of Hoeth
technology.description: There is much to be learned at the Tower of Hoeth, be it history or swordplay.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Melee defence: +4 for Lords and Heroes

technology.name: Strength of Avelorn
technology.description: The maidens of Avelorn invoke the lands which they protect, and Isha, the Mother, answers.

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Sisters of Avelorn and Handmaiden units
Physical resistance: 5% for Sisters of Avelorn and Handmaiden units
Melee defence: +5 for Handmaiden and Sisters of Avelorn units
Diplomatic relations: -100 with all factions except High Elves
Vigour loss reduction: -25% for Dragon Prince and Dragon units

Attribute: Expert Charge Defence
	(all characters factionwide)
Charge bonus: +20% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
Weapon strength: +10% for all units (Rank 7 and above)

Bonus vs Large: +10 when fighting against Bretonnia
	(all characters factionwide)

Leadership: +10 when fighting against Tomb Kings
	(all characters factionwide)

Melee attack: +5 when fighting against Tomb Kings
	(all characters factionwide)
Vigour loss reduction: -10% for cavalry units
Weapon strength: +10% for War Beasts and Monsters
Leadership: +5 when fighting against Dark Elves
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Dark Elves
Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells
Number of uses: +1 for Winds of Magic army abilities

ui_effects.description: ➕ Calls down 15 projectiles each dealing 0 1000 damage and 0 250 explosion damage (4m)

effects.description: Magic resistance: +25% for Swordmasters of Hoeth and Loremasters of Hoeth
Hero capacity: +2 for Loremasters of Hoeth
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Loremasters of Hoeth
Melee attack: +10 for Loremasters of Hoeth
Miscast base chance: -5% for Loremasters of Hoeth

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +50 when fighting against Dwarfs
	(all characters factionwide)

Missile resistance: +25% when fighting against Vampire Coast
	(all characters factionwide)
Casualty replenishment rate: +5% when in foreign territory
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
Fire resistance: 20% for Dryad, Tree Kin, Grove Guardians and Treeman units
Missile resistance: 20% for Dryad, Tree Kin, Grove Guardians and Treeman units
Gifts of Isha generated: +1 per turn

technology.name: Call the Great Herds
technology.description: Many herds of fine Elven steeds roam freely on Ulthuan's wide plains, but can be called to battle when needed.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -10% for cavalry units
Speed: +5% for Chariot and Skycutter units
Speed: +5% for Ellyrian Reavers, Silver Helms and Dragon Princes units

technology.name: Awakening the Ancient Ones
technology.description: Only when there is dire need can the most ancient examples be roused from their slumber.

technology.name: Great Weapons
technology.description: The renowned smiths of Vaul and Hoeth forge greatswords so light and well-balanced they appear to be no lighter than a feather.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace, Phoenix Guard and Dragon Princes units

technology.name: Gemsetting
technology.description: Setting rare gems into jewellery made from precious metals increases their value manyfold.

technology.name: Marble Stockpiles
technology.description: Having a surplus of the finest building materials says something about a society's inherent wealth.

technology.name: Healing Salve
technology.description: "Pain, begone, I will have no more of thee!"

technology.name: Waystone Network
technology.description: Ulthuan's network of Waystones funnel the Winds of Magic towards the Vortex, ensuring tranquillity abounds within its enchanted cloak.

technology.name: Upholders of Order
technology.description: Not everyone understands the true nature of the world's peril. Those who do are more willing to unite against the common enemy.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.name: Court Advisors
technology.description: Where better for the ambitious individual to learn their craft than at a place of high intrigue and low plots?

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

technology.name: Spy Networks
technology.description: The calm, polite eloquence of the Asur ensures their easier acceptance by other cultures, where they may hear and even influence local intrigue.

effects.description:
Magic resistance: +40% when fighting against Lizardmen
	(all characters factionwide)

Melee defence: +10 when fighting against Vampire Counts
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.name: Trade Advancements
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' prosperous economy to a higher level altogether.

technology.name: Hardwood Construction
technology.description: War machines benefit greatly from solid construction using only the finest materials.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Chariot and Skycutter units
Melee defence: +5 for Chariot, Skycutter, War Lion  units

technology.name: Eastern Trade Contracts
technology.description: Those who dare to sail to the far east return with rare luxury goods of which the lesser races can only imagine.

technology.name: Preserved Seafood
technology.description: Salting fish ensures it can be transported inland and still be edible by the time it gets there.

technology.name: Monthly Festivals
technology.description: Elves are partial to the arts and enjoy festivals where poets and bards come to entertain the masses.

technology.name: Extravagant Murals
technology.description: The play may be the thing, but a pleasant environment does much for the mood of the audience.

technology.name: Porcelain Kilns
technology.description: High Elf pottery is produced to a dazzlingly-high standard, as one might expect from a superior race. Naturally, its secrets are closely guarded.

technology.name: Cultural Advancements
technology.description: Research the following items to advance the High Elves' ancient, glorious culture even further.

technology.name: Maritime Empire
technology.description: Visibility is important; it not only ensures that you see events unfold, but that you are seen doing so.

effects.description: All sea regions are made visible to your faction

technology.name: Unite Local Nobility
technology.description: If only they could stop squabbling amongst themselves, then we would truly be invincible.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for High Elf Industry and Resource buildings
Construction time: -1 for High Elf Industry and Resource buildings

technology.name: Rapid Resettlement
technology.description: Recaptured former colonies require less effort to orientate and acclimatise them to the Asur way.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.name: Pinnacle of Civilisation
technology.description: Living on our fair isles of Ulthuan, set in the centre of the Great Ocean, we are far removed from the petty squabbles of the lesser races.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for High Elf Entertainment, Aristocracy and Embassy buildings
Construction time: -1 for High Elf Entertainment, Aristocracy and Embassy buildings
Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors
Chance of being wounded after failure: -10%
Ward save: 5% for Dragon Princes units
Charge bonus: +10 for Dragon Princes units
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Dragon and Dragon Prince units
Weapon strength: +25% for forest spirit units
Gifts of Isha generated: +1 per turn
